messages.content: A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is a formal list of components used in a software system.  It tracks OSS components and their dependencies to manage security and compliance risks.  It provides visibility into the software supply chain, enabling identification and mitigation of potential security and licensing issues.

messages.content: A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is a list of open-source software (OSS) components used in a software product, including dependencies and licenses.  SBOMs provide visibility into the software supply chain, helping identify and mitigate security and licensing issues.  Benefits include lower costs, reduced code bloat, improved security, and a more secure software supply chain.  The two primary SBOM formats are SPDX and CycloneDX.  Creating an SBOM can be time-consuming, but automated generation and readily available tools can alleviate this.  The US government mandates SBOM use in federal software.
